comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
mislabeled photo; this appears to be "left to right: Merrill L. Tribe, Mary Elizabeth Hickox Mandels (1917-2009), and Dale Sieling"
"Left to right: Brig. Gen. Merrill L. Tribe, microbiologist Mary Elizabeth Hickox Mandels (1917-2009), and Dale Sieling. Mandels was a leader in bioenergy research and, during her long career at the U.S. Army Natick Research Laboratory in Massachusetts, she headed the Army's national bioconversion studies. She is shown receiving the 1962 Research Directors Award at the Quartermaster Research and Engineering Center"

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Very detailed Mary Elizabeth Hickox Mandels obituary: www.biotechnologyforbiofuels.com/content/2/1/22 Married to fellow Cornell-trained scientist Gabriel Mandels (d. 1981). Merrill Tribe's obituary, from 1991: www.deseretnews.com/article/140733/DEATH--MERRILL-L-TRIBE...

comment.author: 52257493@N00
comment._content: BG Tribe must have retired from the Army in 1964, not 1954, as noted in his obituary.
